Key Arguments: The bill lacks clear definitions for 'misinformation' and 'disinformation'.
The term 'serious harm' is vague and open to interpretation by the government.
The legislation could lead to discrimination against those with differing views.
Concerns about freedom of speech and potential government propaganda.
The power given to ACMA is excessive and undemocratic.
The proposed fines are considered excessive.
The bill could infringe on religious freedoms.
ACMA members may not have the appropriate expertise to make decisions on complex issues.
The legislation could silence public discourse on important topics like 'the voice' referendum.
Notable Quotes: This proposed bill is an excellent example of both misinformation and disinformation.
Please explain how we will have any freedom of speech which is necessary for democracy if only government propaganda is allowed?
This draconian attempt to silence and intimidate the Australian people is bullying!
